column4: Ex-Googler leads Softbank invasion of Hollywood

column4: Australia clears Expedia's $610 million Wotif.com takeover
column5: SYDNEY Australia's antitrust regulator on Thursday cleared online travel giant Expedia Inc to buy local rival Wotif.com Holdings Ltd  saying it did not expect the A$699 million ($610 million) deal to substantially lessen competition.

column5: Oct 2 Eli Lilly and Co said it would discontinue the development of its lupus drug as the treatment was not found to be effective enough in two late-stage trials.

column5: PARIS  Oct 2 PSA Peugeot Citroen is talking to potential customers for an anticipated surplus of engines as BMW and Ford stop using motors jointly developed with the French carmaker  a senior executive said on Thursday.

column4: Freeport Indonesian copper mine still blockaded after accident
column5: JAKARTA  Oct 2 Protesters blockaded Freeport-McMoRan Inc's Indonesian copper mine for a second day on Thursday  stopping people getting to work  as talks continued between management and employees over the number of fatal accidents at the site.

column4: GM's 2025 platform plan: Simplify and seek to save billions
column5: DETROIT It could be a defining element of Chief Executive Mary Barra's legacy at General Motors Co : A drastic shift over the next 10 years from 26 global vehicle production platforms to just four by 2025  a bold stroke that could eventually save the U.S. automaker many billions of dollars in production costs.

column4: GM recalls 117 651 vehicles for potential electrical short issue
column5: DETROIT General Motors Co  on Thursday said it is recalling 117 651 newer vehicles in North America because a possible manufacturing defect could cause an electrical short and increase the risk of a crash.

column5: LIMA  Oct 1 Peru's state-run energy company Petroperu announced it will partner with GeoPark Limited on the development of an oil block that holds some 55 million barrels of proven and probable light crude reserves.

column5: Royal Bank of Scotland  has hired Goldman Sachs to seek buyers for Coutts International and is expected to tell potential suitors that they will not be allowed to use the Coutts brand  the Financial Times reported.

column4: UPDATE 1-Boss defends NY Fed bank examiners in wake of 'secret' tapes
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 2 The head of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York defended his on-the-ground bank examiners after secretly recorded tapes suggested they were too cozy with Wall Street  saying on Thursday he "completely" stands behind them.

column4: JPMorgan nears sale of parts of physical commodities unit: WSJ
column5: JPMorgan Chase & Co is close to announcing the sale of parts of its physical commodities business - one of the most powerful oil and metals desks on Wall Street - to Swiss trading house Mercuria for $1 billion  the Wall Street Journal reported.

column4: JPMorgan denies NY Times report that its computer system was hacked
column5: Oct 2 JPMorgan Chase & Co denied a report in the New York Times on Thursday that its computer system had been breached for the second time in about three months.

column4: U.S. Air Force seeks to apply satellite savings lessons to other programs
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 2 The U.S. Air Force hopes to translate its recent successes in driving down the cost of huge satellite programs to a range of other weapons  including Lockheed Martin Corp's C-130J transport plane  a top official told Reuters.

column4: Japan  South Korea can stop GMO testing -wheat group official
column5: Oct. 2 Japan and South Korea are continuing to test the U.S. wheat they buy to make sure the grain is not contaminated with an experimental version developed by Monsanto Co  but could soon stop the practice  the head of a U.S. wheat association said on Thursday.

column4: National Oilwell unit pays $1 mln  pleads guilty to export violations
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 2 A unit of National Oilwell Varco Inc agreed to pay a $1 million fine and pleaded guilty Thursday to violating export laws when it shipped components used in oil extraction equipment to a customer in Syria in 2006  the U.S. Justice Department said.

column4: UPDATE 1-Occidental's board approves spin-off of California unit

column5: HOUSTON  Oct 2 Occidental Petroleum Corp  said on Thursday its board of directors has approved the spin-off of its California oil and gas business to its shareholders.

column5: WARSAW Poland's largest telecoms operator Orange Polska  and the country's No.4 lender mBank  have teamed up to launch a mobile service aimed at boosting revenue and retaining customers in competitive markets  they said on Thursday.

column5: CAPRI  Italy  Oct 2 Telecom Italia  debt will be below 25 billion euros ($32 billion) at the end of this year if a mandatory convertible bond is considered as equity capital  the CEO said on Thursday.

column4: Telecom Italia CEO says not studying any capital increase
column5: CAPRI Italy Telecom Italia  Chief Executive Marco Patuano said on Thursday the group is not studying any capital increase  adding that the completion of a planned sale of its Italian mobile towers would not be completed this year as initially expected.

column5: SAO PAULO  Oct 2 Steelmaking group Ternium SA  agreed on Thursday to pay 616.7 million reais ($247 million) to pension fund Previ for a stake in Usiminas  as a battle for control of the beleaguered Brazilian mill heats up.

column4: Daimler cuts car market forecast as Europe wobbles

column4: SINGAPORE PRESS-Visa to create 185 new technology jobs-Business Times
column5: Visa Inc will expand its technology hub in Singapore  which will see it create about 185 new technology research and development jobs  the Business Times reported.

column4: Disney extends CEO Iger's contract through June 2018
column5: LOS ANGELES Walt Disney Co's board extended Chairman and Chief Executive Bob Iger's contract through June 2018  keeping him at the helm of the media and theme park company two years longer than he previously planned.

column5: Wayfair Inc's  shares rose as much as 27 percent in their market debut on Thursday  valuing the online home furnishings retailer at about $3.06 billion.
